title: Bug 45145: Second window comes to front when using first
OB: When switching from another application to one Eclipse window and then clicking on a docked view or perspective, the other Eclipse window comes to the front and covers windows of other applications.
EB: The only time a window should come to the front is if I click on it explicitly, or if some behavior takes me to a widget in the other window. Unless I click on the Eclipse dock icon, the second window should not automatically come to the front.
SR:
1. Open another application or window.
2. Switch to an Eclipse window.
3. Click on a docked view or perspective.
4. Observe that the second Eclipse window comes to the front and covers other application windows.
